name: Iguana Reef Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved our time on the island of Caye Caulker and would recommend to anyone wanting an island getaway. Iguana Reef exceeded all of our expectations and would go there again in a heartbeat. A must visit especially if you like a small, quaint island feel.
reviews.title: Amazing spot

reviews.text: A very clean, stylish and well maintained hotel with large rooms and nice surroundings. The garden, swimmingpool and all other common areas in the hotel was very well maintained and gave a great impression. The service was splendid and when i talked to the janitor he seemed very proud of his work and the hotel.
reviews.title: Style and great service

reviews.text: The only backside was that we could hear the other guests in the neighburing rooms when talking. The prize is also at the upper end, but you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Luxurious place on an easygoing island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At $200/night, Iguana Reef is no bargain - especially on a small, easygoing island with many cheaper options - but you get the luxury you pay for. Because Caye Caulker's beaches are poor, the pool is nice (tho unheated - in December we wished it was). The rooms are quite sizable - very comfy for our family of four - with a nice, clean modern bathrooms. No TVs in the rooms, but that was fine for us.
reviews.title: This may very well be the nicest place on the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Iguana Reef is located on the "back" of the island - not the ocean side - and we found that a plus. Quieter, and Caye Caulker is so small you aren't "far away" from anything. Plus if you play soccer, the local pick-up games happen behind the inn! (Don't worry, not noisy.)
reviews.title: Beautiful looking hotel, but a little overpriced for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Iguana Reef Inn initially for four nights, but then extended our stay because we found it to be so nice. It's a great place to start off your vacation in Belize and calm down. Everything will be taken care off for you by the very friendly and helpful staff. I suggest that you get to know the staff and don't just regard them as regular hotel staff. They will tell you an amazing amount about themselves and this made us feel very welcome.
reviews.title: What a wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an extra garden house which was amazing and is not yet listed on the website. The only down-side is that there is construction going on nearby, but it didn't interfere with relaxing on the pool or in the hammock area.
reviews.title: Best on the Island - Still!

reviews.text: We loved the hotel. If you have the money to spend, then it's the perfect start of a vacation in Belize.
reviews.title: Major construction work next door- don't stay here!

reviews.text: Our trip to Caye Caulker and Iguana Reef Inn was great as usual, having stayed a number of times previously. The Inn has grown over the years, but always maintained its charm and continues to be the class of the Island. While not cheap, it is an excellent value. The breakfast offered in the mornings is a nice touch, and kept us from having to go out into town.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and decorated with an island style. We were again nicely suprised that the property looks brand new. The staff seems very detail oriented. It shows.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on the Island. Awesome Sunsets!!!

reviews.text: The Iguana Reef Inn provides a good value on Caye Caulker. A little more expensive than other places available but a lot nicer too. The rooms were clean, with big comfortable beds, the air conditioning worked great and the staff was pleasant. A decent breakfast is also included. Caye Caulker is tiny, 15-20 minutes to walk the whole island basically, so you can get to any of the restaruants on foot easily from the hotel. They also have a western view, so you get awesome sunsets too. Overall, good bang for your buck at the Iguana Reef.
reviews.title: Quality on Caye Caulker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the best hotel on Caye Caulker, Iguana Reef Inn is located just next door to the Belize Diving Services (probably the best dive operator on the island). Very convenient for scuba divers. Neatly carred for hotel grounds. Nice, clean, spacious rooms. Relaxing pool area. Friendly staff.
reviews.title: Perfect for Scuba Divers

reviews.text: It was all perfect! We travelled by car from Cozumel all the way to Belize City, we were supposed to catch a ferry at Chetumal Mexico to Caye Caulker but didnt arrived on time so we kept driving to Belize City. We where in contact by email with the staff at the hotel and they told us all the options we had since we missed that ferry at Chetumal. They were extremely helpful. They sended Domingo to receive us at Belize City wich was great! he helped us check in at the Hotel in Belize City and drove us to the Taxi Boat the next day!!
reviews.title: Perfecto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was great, big and very confortable. loved the enormous balcony, the view and the sunsets!
reviews.title: Loved, loved, loved it....

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was also very nice.
reviews.title: I came seeking peace, all I found was noise!

reviews.text: We just returned from a short 3 days on Caye Caulker. We picked this island because I thought that Ambergris Caye would be too crowded with spring break travelers. We are very glad that we chose Iguana Reef for our stay. We liked that it was on the "other side" of the island. It was quiet, with great sunsets, but a close walk to everything. The friendly management arranged all our excursions; 1/2 day reef fishing with a local guide, a full day of snorkeling with Carlos Tours, and our plane trip back to BC airport. It was quite hot while we were there and the pool was perfect! We also greatly appreciated the large air conditioned rooms. We had a standard seaside room on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool, and a 2nd floor standard parkside room. Actually, the parkside room was nicer because it was a corner room with lots of windows. We enjoyed the breakfasts each morning and had a tasty lunch by the pool one day. We would definitely stay at Iguana Reef again and would choose Caye Caulker.
reviews.title: Totally relaxing!
The trip to compare all other trips to
reviews.text: We had an amazing time in Caye Caulker. Our stay at the Iguana Reef exceeded our expectations. The staff at the Iguana Reef did everything in their power to make our visit to Caye Caulker a trip to remember. It was our first time in Belize, and we went on a recommendation of a friend who had stayed at the Iguana Reef - as they say word of mouth is the best advertisement. We were so glad we stayed at the Iguana Reef. Plenty of great hotels on the island but I think Iguana Reef is the class of the island. We are already counting down the days until we can return to Caye Caulker and we will be staying at the Iguana Reef for our return trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to Caye Caulker 8 times in the last two years. I've stayed at Iguana Reef Inn 5 of those visits and also tried out a few other hotels on the island. THIS IS the best hotel on the island, well worth the wee bit extra $! The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel and grounds are beautifully maintained. The coffee at breakfast is the best on the island and plentiful, and the poolside lunch selections are yummy. It's true Iguana Reef is on the west side of the island not the east/beach side, but that just means you get a magnificent sunset by the sea each evening. What could be better than that?!
reviews.title: The Best, No Question

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose this hotel because it looked great and we had never been to Caye Caulker. It was very nice and clean but a little over the top now that we know what else there is on the Island. It was far from the main drag which is actually only a stones throw away but -- it would have been nicer to be on the beach side instead of the Lagoon side. I thought we would use the pool but never did. We did take out the kayaks which was fun. We did have a nice room and we slept well. I do think we could have saved a bit of money though.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not worth money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general we had a very good time at Iguana Reef. The staff were friendly, and the private pool and beach area were very luxurious, particuarly as the island does not have good beaches.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not value for money

description: Iguana Reef Inn is located on the water's edge, in a secluded location in the heart of a charming village. The Inn offers decidedly upscale accommodations and the enchantment of the "Old Caribbean" island lifestyle. Relax on the verandah of one of the Inn's richly textured rooms or poolside and settle into the unhurried pace of the island. The Inn's ideal location is just minutes away from the restaurants and night spots on Caye Caulker.
